metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, PHP, Python, Bootstrap, Java and XML.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: You have already seen the following code a couple of times in the first chapters. Let's break it down to understand it better:
content.html: You have already seen the following code a couple of times in the first chapters. Let's break it down to understand it better:

content.code_html:
#include <stdio.h>

int main() {
  printf("Hello World!");
  return 0;
}

content.text: Line 1: #include <stdio.h> is a header file library that lets us work with input and output functions, such as printf() (used in line 4). Header files add functionality to C programs.
content.html: Line 1: #include <stdio.h> is a header file library that lets us work with input and output functions, such as printf() (used in line 4). Header files add functionality to C programs.

content.text: Don't worry if you don't understand how #include <stdio.h> works. Just think of it as something that (almost) always appears in your program.
content.html: Don't worry if you don't understand how  #include <stdio.h> works. Just think of it as something that (almost) always appears in your program.

content.text: Line 2: A blank line. C ignores white space. But we use it to make the code more readable.
content.html: Line 2: A blank line. C ignores white space. But we use it to make the code more readable.

content.text: Line 3: Another thing that always appear in a C program is main() . This is called a function . Any code inside its curly brackets {} will be executed.
content.html: Line 3: Another thing that always appear in a C program is main(). This is called a function. Any code inside its curly brackets {} will be executed.

content.text: Line 4: printf() is a function used to output/print text to the screen. In our example, it will output "Hello World!".
content.html: Line 4: printf() is a function used to output/print text to the screen. In our example, it will output "Hello World!".

content.text: Note that: Every C statement ends with a semicolon ;
content.html: Note that: Every C statement ends with a semicolon ;

content.text: Note: The body of int main() could also been written as: int main(){printf("Hello World!");return 0;}
content.html:
Note: The body of int main() could also been written as:
int main(){printf("Hello World!");return 0;}

content.text: Remember: The compiler ignores white spaces. However, multiple lines makes the code more readable.
content.html: Remember: The compiler ignores white spaces. However, multiple lines makes the code more readable.

content.text: Line 5: return 0 ends the main() function.
Line 6: Do not forget to add the closing curly bracket } to actually end the main function.
content.html: Line 6: Do not forget to add the closing curly bracket } to actually end the main function.

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What is the purpose of #include <stdio.h> in a C program?
content.html: What is the purpose of #include <stdio.h> in a C program?
